description.narrative: Output 2.1 National and local institutions have strengthened capacity for improved management of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services, which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable, have improved access to equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation, hygiene practices and healthy environments

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
